meanings.definition: Aurochs: an extinct wild ox of Europe, Asia, and North Africa, that was the ancestor of domestic cattle.
meanings.sent1: The aurochs roamed freely across the ancient lands.
meanings.sent2: Farmers domesticated aurochs to create modern cattle breeds.
meanings.sent3: The aurochs decided to take a vacation from being the ancestors of domestic cattle.
meanings.sent4: In history books, the aurochs stands as a symbol of untamed wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The image of the aurochs charging through the grasslands is etched in our minds.
